page.title: 11LOCAL MEDIA IN HORSHAM
page.content: Horsham and districts local newspaper is The West Sussex County Times, which has been going since 1869. It's own printing works are in the town and it is published every Friday costing 10p. The editor Mr. David Briffet has worked for the paper since 1977. The workforce consists of 170 people split into four departments. The paper costs between Â£15000-Â£20000 to produce and is financed mainly through adverts. Mr. Briffet believes the paper has a good future because Horsham provides plenty of news. The chief reporter decides who should cover a story and whether to use a photographer. The report is typed into the computer before the weekly edition is put to press.
